abstracts.cdata!:
The Post-Accession Rural Support Project
            (PARSP) for Poland will: (i) increase social inclusion in
            rural underdeveloped gminas by enhancing the capacity of
            local governments to identify, plan, and execute social
            protection strategies through a Social Inclusion Program
            (SIP); and (ii) support agricultural insurance fund (KRUS)
            reform by enhancing the efficiency of the KRUS Agency,
            through strengthening its administrative and analytic
            capacity and improving its management and decision making
            process. The closing date for the project will be extended
            from June 30, 2011 until December 30, 2011. The extension is
            necessary to ensure that the functionality of component A of
            the project - the integrated farmers' social insurance
            (KRUS) system architecture be secured. KRUS administration
            reform implementation is proceeding satisfactorily and the
            most critical sub-component, the workflow system, is planned
            to be completed before June 30, 2011. However, two packages
            - management support system and archival system - have
            entailed complex procurement processes and timeframes for
            their implementation now extend beyond the current
            project's closing date. Procurement due diligence and
            support for each of these packages has required supplemental
            support and in the case of the Archive component,
            re-tendering. This second extension of the project closing
            date is necessary to ensure that the remaining component
            implementation is completed and that full functionality and
            integration of the KRUS system can be achieved. The Borrower
            has in place an action plan to complete the project by the
            end of the extension period.
